item.title: Netflix lands golden ticket by buying Roald Dahl estate
item.description: The streaming giant will own and control works like Charlie and the Chocolate Factory and Matilda.

item.title: The Many Saints of Newark: Sopranos prequel impresses many critics
item.description: Michael Gandolfini plays a teenage Tony Soprano, who was portrayed by his father James on TV.

item.title: Sex and the City actors remember co-star Willie Garson
item.description: The actor, who has died aged 57, was known for his role as Stanford Blatch in the series and films.

item.title: Rolling Stones resume live shows with emotional Charlie Watts tribute
item.description: Sir Mick Jagger dedicates the band's comeback show to the late drummer, who died last month aged 80.

item.title: Major record labels could face competition inquiry
item.description: The competition watchdog has been asked whether major record labels are distorting the market.

item.title: Museum of the Year: Colchester gallery Firstsite wins £100,000 prize
item.description: Alongside top exhibitions, its café became a canteen offering free school meals during the pandemic.

item.title: Quarter of a million pupils to join BBC's Share Your Story
item.description: BBC stars and staff invite teenagers to share their stories to help recover from the pandemic.

item.title: Abba's Bjorn Ulvaeus launches campaign to fix £500m music royalty problem
item.description: Bjorn Ulvaeus launches a campaign to ensure musicians don't miss out on unpaid royalties.

item.title: Harry Styles haunts Noel Gallagher with win at Ivor Novello Awards
item.description: It's eight years after Noel Gallagher praised the event because "clowns like One Direction" don't win.

item.title: Cabaret Voltaire electronic music pioneer Richard H Kirk dies
item.description: The Sheffield band were a big influence on a generation of pop, house, techno and art-rock artists.

item.title: SSD Concerts: Questions over This Is Tomorrow festival work
item.description: Bands severed ties with SSD Concerts amid sexual harassment allegations against the firm's founder.

item.title: Culture wars make BBC impartiality tougher, director general Tim Davie says
item.description: It's harder than ever for the BBC to maintain impartiality, the corporation's director general says.

item.title: R. Kelly not expected to testify at his trial
item.description: The star, who once protested his innocence in a tearful TV interview, is unlikely to take the stand.

item.title: Fifa 22 soundtrack: Why getting on it is a 'bucket list' moment
item.description: This is what it means to young artists to be featured on the playlist for the latest Fifa game.

item.title: Sex Education: Isaac actor George Robinson gets intimate about disability
item.description: George Robinson on subverting expectations as Isaac - the Netflix show's first disabled character.

item.title: CEO Secrets: 'In my business, you eat what you kill'
item.description: Music executive Riki Bleau shares his business advice for our CEO Secrets series.

item.title: Twitch hate raids: Minority streamers have 'a target on their back'
item.description: Streamers tell Newsbeat about the targeted hate they get and what they want Twitch to do about it.

item.title: John Challis: Why Serbians have soft spot for late Only Fools actor
item.description: Only Fools and Horses is hugely popular in Serbia, where tributes have been paid to John Challis.

item.title: Emmy Awards 2021: The red carpet looks in pictures
item.description: Kaley Cuoco, Olivia Colman and Gillian Anderson are among the stars attending the ceremony.

item.title: Ted Lasso: What's the big deal about Emmy-winning football comedy?
item.description: The Apple TV comedy series won several major prizes at Sunday night's Emmy awards.

item.title: John Challis and Boycie - how one of TV's greatest comedy characters was born
item.description: The late actor was known for playing Only Fools and Horses' smarmy second-hand car salesman Boycie.

item.title: BTS: Korean boyband open UN general debate with performance and speech
item.description: The UN general debate opened with K-pop band BTS, followed by a speech about sustainable development.

item.title: Emmy Awards 2021: The Crown and Ted Lasso win big
item.description: Netflix drama The Crown and Apple TV Plus comedy Ted Lasso were the stars of the Emmy Award.

item.title: Morgan Bullock makes professional debut in Riverdance
item.description: Morgan Bullock from Richmond, Virginia, joins the UK touring company of the acclaimed Irish dance show.

item.title: Street dreams of Nairobi dance crew hoping to beat the odds
item.description: A group of street dancers in Nairobi, Kenya, struggle against the odds to become celebrities.

item.title: Get an Eiffel of this performer walking the line in Paris
item.description: Nathan Paulin walks along a 70m (230ft) high slackline attached to an iconic French landmark.

item.title: Carol Kirkwood: BBC Weather presenter pulled over by dog on live TV
item.description: Carol Kirkwood says she's fine after taking this tumble on BBC Breakfast when the guide dog went astray.
